body:
## Summary

Corrects three documentation errors in `gateway/README.md` identified during PR review:
- Hardcoded personal filesystem path â†’ generic relative path
- Wrong `REQUEST_TIMEOUT_MS` default (2000 vs actual 5000)
- Invalid npm script reference (`npm run dev` â†’ `npm start`)

## MVP Impact (What Got More Real)

Documentation now matches actual implementation:
- `REQUEST_TIMEOUT_MS` default correctly documented as `5000` (matches `gateway/src/server.ts:36`)
- Run instructions use valid `npm start` command (matches `gateway/package.json` scripts)
- Path instructions are portable, not machine-specific

## End-State Impact (What This Enables Later)

Reduces onboarding friction and eliminates doc-code drift for gateway configuration.

## How To Test

```bash
# Verify timeout default matches implementation
grep "REQUEST_TIMEOUT_MS" gateway/src/server.ts gateway/README.md

# Verify npm script exists
grep '"start"' gateway/package.json

# Verify README instructions work
cd gateway
npm install
npm run build
PORT=8054 npm start
```

## Verification Evidence

- Commit `9e58e13`: all three fixes applied
- Diff confirms only documentation changes, no code modification

## Checklist

- [x] Docs updated (MVP vs End-State clearly labeled)
- [x] No build artifacts committed (`target/`, `node_modules/`, ledgers)
- [x] Devnet/local instructions verified (or explicitly marked blocked)
- [x] Security note added if auth/keys/permissions were touched

commits.messageHeadline: docs: fix gateway README.md path, timeout default, and npm command

title: docs: fix gateway README inaccuracies (path, timeout default, npm script)
